comments.author: Susan
comments.content: Oh yum.  Question:  how do you know if a salsa is smoky?

comments.author: Patrick Ross
comments.content: I love Tacos, and the recipe you are sharing seems amazing, and so easy to prepare! Great stuff in your site, as always. Thanks!

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: If it has chipotle, it will be smoky; otherwise it will generally say something about smokiness on the label. "Fire roasted" could be another cue. Or try this one: https://herbivoracious.com/2011/07/smoked-pineapple-and-tomatillo-salsa-recipe.html

comments.author: Susan
comments.content: Oh God, that pineapple and tomatilla salsa recipe is killing me.  I love salsa recipes with a piquaint fuit flavor. Question:  is there an easier way to introduce the smoky flavor, like using a small amount of that smoke condiment, whose name escapes me right now?  Or would that be a gross and disgusting cheat?  Thank you for your help.

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: You could try liquid smoke, but start with literally a drop. Or, you could use a smoked salt. This one is great: http://amzn.to/1hdNOXD . Or, you could get a smoking gun, I have one and love it: http://amzn.to/1bSECkk

comments.author: Wedding Catering Services
comments.content: Lovely breakfast tacos...I like this and thanks for sharing this recipe..It is really easy to prepare..

comments.author: Mel
comments.content: Try the Chipotle Tobasco.  Great on eggs of any kind.

comments.author: Alexandre Raymundo
comments.content: Love these tacos, thanks for sharing the recipe.

comments.author: Sharon
comments.content: Saw your blog mentioned in an article. I now follow you and John Contratti's "Cooking With Mr. C." They're my two favorite blogs.  Happy Thanksgiving.   Sharon

comments.author: Jennifer
comments.content: I really must get into Breakfast Burritos/Taco's more!  I would use tofu instead of eggs or maybe the potato would be just as good, too!  These look awesome!

comments.author: Michele Neller
comments.content: I love anything that has a latin theme! These look amazing I think i will have to try today!

comments.author: Greg Urbano
comments.content: Fresh tortillas are the real secret!

comments.author: Garage Gyms
comments.content: Ya I'm in Austin and there is definitely no shortage of good Mexican food, which means lots and lots of breakfast tacos of all kinds of varieties. Hard to go wrong when a tortilla is involved though =)

comments.author: Jacob
comments.content: I just see it already contains salivating. very tasty likely

comments.author: Judit + Corina @WineDineDaily
comments.content: These breakfast tacos look so tasty with all that fresh cilantro! J+C

comments.author: Tony
comments.content:
Susan dip you finger in the salsa if it "bites" to hot, add a couple of drops of cream or milk, that will counter the acid from the chile to a more mild eatable level if you are not used to the heat of good smoking hot pepper like cascabel, Jalapeno, o de arbol.
Hope that will help next time you get the sting of a hot salsa

GB

Tony

comments.author: Susan
comments.content: Tony, thank you for the tip!  I have trouble with ulcers, so can't tolerate a lot of heat, but hate missing out on otherwise great food.  Can't wait to give your suggestion a try.  Susan

comments.author: Lazy Smurf
comments.content: I'm glad you've fallen in love with the breakfast taco! Whenever I leave Austin it's the first thing I get when I come back.

comments.author: PaisleyPear
comments.content: I take issue with your statement that the options for breakfast tacos at AIBA are "dismal." Our very charming airport only allows local vendors and therefore offers much of the same great taco options you would find around town. Here's a link to an Eater article from 2011 but, like the rest of Austin, the airport and the dining options have grown since then. Love your site!

comments.author: frances
comments.content: one of your next trips, you should try Juan in a Million if you haven't yet. one of my faves when i lived there. its on east cesar chavez--on the east side of 35. yummm yumm. However, its hard to get a bad breakfast taco there.
